title: Children's exposure to secondhand smoke may be vastly underestimated by parents

title_detail.value: Children's exposure to secondhand smoke may be vastly underestimated by parents

summary: A new study suggests that parents who smoke mistakenly rely on their own physical senses to gauge the presence of tobacco smoke in the air.

summary_detail.value: A new study suggests that parents who smoke mistakenly rely on their own physical senses to gauge the presence of tobacco smoke in the air.
